title: Psychosocial and Financial Impact of Dermatophytosis on Patients in Visakhapatnam
summary: A cross-sectional study conducted at a tertiary care centre in Visakhapatnam examining the psychological, social, and financial effects of dermatophytosis (fungal skin infection) on affected patients.
content:
The study investigated the impact of dermatophytosis on patients seeking treatment at a tertiary care facility in Visakhapatnam. Research focused on analyzing both the psychosocial consequences and financial burden experienced by individuals affected by this fungal skin infection. 

The assessment was conducted through a cross-sectional methodology, gathering data from patients attending the medical center. The study aimed to provide insights into how this common dermatological condition affects patients' quality of life and economic status.

While the specific findings are not detailed in the source material, the research highlights the importance of considering both medical and socioeconomic aspects of dermatophytosis treatment and management.
